description.narrative: Associação Moçambicana Mulher e Educação (AMME) is a civil society entity, Mozambican, non-profit and oriented to support development. Created in 2012 and legally constituted through BR nº 47 of the II series. The current governing board was elected atthe last Ordinary General Assembly held in August 2015. The organization has 150 members with more than 50% women. AMME already has a 5-year history of collaboration with Oxfam IBIS. The thematic focus of this partnership has always been on working on access and retention of young girls at schools though strengthening and capacity building of school councils. The partnership has contributed significantly to the development of the skills of AMME staff, particularly in the field of school council strengthening. In terms of fund management, the organization currently has more than 7 partner organizations that finance AMME with a total annual value of approximately USD 670,500. The audit reports assessed by Oxfam do not undermine the organization in terms offund management since the AMME has adecentralized management structure and internal procedures manuals. In this particular project, AMME will contribute to improving the pedagogical performance of students through retention and completion of student in the first and second cycle of primary education and the active participation of SC in school management and pedagogy of the school, by supporting combine three key priority areasof actions: dismantling the barriers to access to education including sanitation facilities such as latrines and toilets for students and improving the reading and writing students competences; strengthening the capacity of participation of School Council; and improving and strengthening and school managers governance, and also byincreasing the number of instructional hours may be necessary but it is not sufficient – as much attention needs to be given to what happens during these instructional hours. The partner will introduce and pilot reading clubs within the existing Gils’s Clubs and Listening Group that were created in the previous project and are being supported to address the GBV and ensure the fulfilment of girls rights, and to give response to the social norms that affectboys and girl access, retention and completion oftheir school ambitions; as well as organize children quarterly reading competitions intra-class, between classes, schools in the same ZIP and between ZIPs

participating-org.narrative: AMME Assoc Moçambicana Muher e Educ Associator Moçambicana Muher e Educ

Associação Moçambicana Mulher e Educação (AMME) is a civil society entity, Mozambican, non-profit and oriented to support development. Created in 2012 and legally constituted through BR nº 47 of the II series. The current governing board was elected atthe last Ordinary General Assembly held in August 2015. The organization has 150 members with more than 50% women. AMME already has a 5-year history of collaboration with Oxfam IBIS. The thematic focus of this partnership has always been on working on access and retention of young girls at schools though strengthening and capacity building of school councils. The partnership has contributed significantly to the development of the skills of AMME staff, particularly in the field of school council strengthening. In terms of fund management, the organization currently has more than 7 partner organizations that finance AMME with a total annual value of approximately USD 670,500. The audit reports assessed by Oxfam do not undermine the organization in terms offund management since the AMME has adecentralized management structure and internal procedures manuals. In this project AMME will play a role of implementation where they do capacity development of school councils in 6 districts in the province of Zambezia, documentation of results and best practices and elaboration of reports on activities. They also play a significant role on community mobilization by mounting awareness campaigns through media such as radio, theatre etc. It is their duty as well to ensure the monitoring of the day-by-day activities of the project.
